metadata.title: CVE-2020-2660 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Optimizer). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.28 andprior and 8.0.18 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows highprivileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols tocompromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatablecrash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 4.9 (Availabilityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-2660` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-client - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-router - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-server - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.19-0ubuntu2').
